column4: anyone know how to lock the touchpad during typing in ubuntu 11.04?
see if there is a preference in the mouse settings
its not
it would be synaptics something
i'll search for a synaptics package to install (i believe synaptic is also the package manager name)
no, no software found in the software manager
there are two things called synaptic one is the package manager the other is the touchpad driver
okay, it is synaptiks
assuming you are using xorg-input-synaptics driver for the touchpad the gnome mouse settings should show you a touchpad tab
the computer came with ubuntu 11.04 already install, don't know, i could check apt-get to see if its installed
grep -i synaptic /var/log/Xorg.0.log
i checked for that synaptics-input-xorg program but there is a bug in apt-get where it will not check if you have the program installed first before telling you another program is locking dpkg
with the grep nothing comes up; nano pulls it up and no findings of "synaptic" or "touchpad" in the log
what kind of touchpad is this? what kind of laptop? what does xinput --list say about it
i'll dump online the log, can you url me?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/624495/
seems that it doesn't recognize this touchpad and just assumes its a mouse
probably the thing to do is force synaptics to control it
its definately a touchpad, i am installing synaptiks (with a k) now, its 80 mb donwload
see http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1502560
thanks, i'll use that when it installed, thanks again for your help and patience
see bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/311869
